Blog.post: Memorial Day Weekend. I love 3 day weekends! Well, who doesn't. I got a lot done this weekend. My friends Cindy and Al bought me a new computer desk and shelf for my birthday. I ended up gutting my room and rearranging everything. It's quite nice. It needed to be cleaned desperately. I also went out and bought a matching TV stand to replace the rickety stand that I had. It looks a million times nicer. It even seems a little bit rommier in here (which is totally an optical illusion since this room is too small for Malibu Barbie). Anyway, I really feel like I accomplished something.

Well, today was my 34th birthday. It was a good day...no one forgot. Last Sunday, I had a birthday party with my friends and got some nice gifts. Tonight, I had dinner with some friends at Carrabba's. The food was excellent and I had a great time. Normally, I don't think I feel older on my birthday -- well, except maybe 31 -- but I do feel a little older today. I don't know if that's good or bad. Hmm.

I added a "viewer rating" voting feature to my "Will & Grace" web site. It's pretty cool. I noticed that there is some abuse though. I guess I'll have to add IP tracking and if someone revotes on an episode, then it just changes their current vote. I had hoped not to do that....
How awesome were the Must See TV finales last night?! "Friends" and "Will & Grace" were just great. I can't wait until next season.
The server change is completed!

I received an award today at work... Supply Chain Excellence Award for 1st Quarter 2003, from the Avon Glenview facility. I was very surprised. It was a nice moment.... I think I'll take my coworkers to lunch tomorrow.... (Just looked at the menu for tomorrow, baked pork chop. Yuck. Definitely going out.)

Due to increasing bandwidth and storage requirements, my entire website will be moving to another server in the very near future. I also have a completely new design for the main page. I haven't touched the current page in years and it looks like crap. I'll still be with the same web host, urlLink Interland , just on a newer, faster server. It should be a seamless transistion, but let urlLink me know if you find any broken links or images.
I've been listening to urlLink Madonna 's new album, American Life . It's got some great songs on it. My favorite song on the CD is "Intervention."
This is my new web log. I hope to put something in here at least once a week. Thanks for visiting!
Damn. I haven't written in here in a long time. I've been busy! Anyway the weather really sucks. It's depressing. But on the other hand, I have a good reason to be happy these days....

Well, today was a fun packed day. I went to see Finding Nemo with Cindy and Al and Alex. It was a great movie, very funny, and very cute. Ellen DeGeneres is a riot. It was much more enjoyable than Matrix Reloaded . After that, I went ATVing with Al and Cindy. Now, that was something different. It was kind of scary, but at the same time really fun! I think Al was trying to kill me. I'm wore out. Time for bed....

I went to see The Matrix Reloaded tonight. It was good, not great, but good. I don't really get why people get so worked up about The Matrix . Sure, the special effects are good, but how many slow-motion fight scenes can they pack into a movie? Apparently, not enough. But, who am I to say; I'm a Star Wars and Star Trek geek!
Happy Birthday, Doug!

The weather out here is great. All of the people in the branch are very friendly, and they all think I'm great. I certainly can't say the same thing about Atlanta. Hmph. Anyway, I am so ready to come home!!
I had to fly out to the Pasadena branch for work. They are having an emergency they need my help with. I don't really want to go, but I don't really have a choice. Oh well....
OH. MY. GOD. These people at work are just killing me. They are trying to stress me out and I'm trying not to let them get to me.

I spent the day in Macon with my boyfriend yesterday. We had a really good time just hanging out and talking and laughing. I really love him. All of my friends are out of town and today I was kind of bored, so I decided to go to the movies. I saw The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen . It was a lot better than I thought it was going to be. On Friday, I saw 28 Days Later . It was ok, but not great. It wasn't really all that scary; you didn't feel any real threat from the zombies. It started out kind of interesting, but then just got stupid at the point they got to the blockade.

This Fourth of July weekend was great this year. The best ever. My boyfriend stayed with me for the weekend. My friends came over Saturday and we had steaks on the grill and a big dinner. Everything was great....
Work is crazy. I'm finding myself back in the long hours and weekends and stress is high. I'm trying to back off some, but you know how it is....
My promotion to "Lead IT Analyst" is supposed to be effective today, but I haven't seen any official paperwork yet....
Happy birthday, Edie!
I finally have some time to catch up on my "Will & Grace" web page. Thanks to everyone for being so patient....

I saw two movies this weekend: The Order and Dickie Roberts: Child Star . They were ok. Pickings were kind of slim. The Order was good, it was kind of wierd, and not really what I was expecting. Dickie had some very funny moments in it, and was actually more enjoyable that I thought it would be. There was a trailer for Alien: The Director's Cut before The Order . I am dying to see that. I wasn't even aware that they were preparing a re-release of the original Alien movie. It is going to be AWESOME.
Happy Halloween tomorrow! I'm leaving for Savannah for a week. Yay!

My promotion to "Lead IT Analyst" was announced today, effective November 17th. They had a cake in my department today and they announced it to the management team. Nearly everyone was nice to me. It was a good day...
I spent the week with Doug in Savannah. It was most excellent. I won't bore you with the details, but I'm the happiest person in the world!
Doug and I had our Christmas today. It was really nice. I was so happy that he liked all of his gifts! And, of course, I was very happy with mine!

Well, I'm back from Michigan. I went home for a few days to see my family. Everyone is doing well. Skyler and Kayla are getting big. They are so cute! I went to my Aunt's house on Christmas and got to see a lot of relatives that I don't see very often, which was nice. Mom made us a nice turkey dinner on Friday...yum...

Just saw The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King . It was absolutely amazing. We went to the brand new AMC Discover Mills 18 theater, just opened last night. It is a very nice theater, and so close to home. I will probably go see it again this weekend....
Ooh! Hollywood 24 is playing Special Extended Edition - The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring . I must see that this week on the big screen....
All of my friends have ditched me for work or a trip to Mall of America. I think I'll go to the movies by myself tonight....
Doug told me today that he has a good lead on a job in the Atlanta area. Hopefully, he'll be moving soon. Yay!
Today is my brother's birthday. Happy Birthday, Chris!

This 4th quarter at work has been so much better than last year. We're working a lot, but it's not nearly as bad as last year. Hell, it's not even as bad as it was back in Campaigns 17-19 of this year!
I bought the Alien Quadrilogy box set today on DVD. I used a coupon and got it for $60 at Best Buy. It is awesome!
I picked a new Template! Ooh... Aah...
Woo-hoo! My application for my apartment was approved and I'm going to move next month. Does anyone want to pack my stuff and move it over to my new place????

GEEK ALERT! I bought one of the Abacus SPOT watches yesterday. It is really cool. It receives data over FM radio band from MSNDirect. The watch is a little big, and a little geeky looking. The screen is very easy to read. I usually keep it on the "Glance" channel ... it scrolls the news, weather, stock quotes. You can configure what you want to see using the direct.msn.com web site. You can also download an Outlook add-on that syncronized your calender. The watch will then display a message and play a little tune before your appointments. Fun!
HAPPY NEW YEAR!

Well, I moved all my stuff into my new apartment. I can't believe how fast we moved my stuff! I had everything packed up and in the garage. We had to take apart the bed, and move the bedroom furniture. We finished in less than two hours. It was amazing. All of my friends were very impressed with my packing! Of course, it will take forever to get everything put away....

Yay! I bought two tickets to see the Madonna Re-Invention World Tour! I got seats for the Atlanta July 24th show at Philips Arena, Section 113. Cindy and I are going and we are going to have the best time ever. We saw the Drowned World Tour at Philips back in 2001. We also saw the Blond Ambition World Tour back in 1990 in Detroit with some of our frends from college. I can't believe how long ago that was....
I have to go to an IT conference in New York this week for Work. Doug had his best friend from back home come visit this week. I met him when I got back on Friday. He's a very nice guy.
All of Doug's stuff has arrived and he has moved in. Everything has been put away and we had a nice little get-together with my friends. They all love Doug. Everything is perfect.
Today is both Todd's and Sam's birthday. HAPPY BIRTHDAY!

Cindy and Al finally broke up. She's not taking it too well, but in the long run she knows she did the right thing. I think so too. We got to hang out a little bit this weekend. She always has to work at her night job, though. (She teaches Pre-K and works at a restaurant part time). I feel really bad that we don't get to spend more time together. Hopefully this summer will be better, since she won't have school and will be able to get some stuff done around her house.
Doug starts a brand new job tomorrow. He's really excited. I'm so proud of him! After a week off, the thought of going back to Slavon tomorrow makes me want to puke...

I had my birthday celebration with my friends today. We went out to eat and then everyone came over for cake and presents. I had the best time. It was so nice that everyone came over and we got to hang out together for a while. Doug's friends Warren and Brian also came from Savannah. It was nice to finally meet Brian. I was so happy that he and Warren could come. It was nice that they got a long with all of my friends as well. And I got some great gifts, of course! While I was out to see Mean Girls with Cindy, Doug decorated the apartment with banners and balloons. But I cannot believe that he ruined that gorgeous cake with a 3 and a 5 candle! I'd like to give a shout out to: Doug, Cindy, Todd, Jody, Edie, Holly, Al, Warren, Brian, Anna, Riley, Sam and Alex.
Happy Birthday to me! Today was the best birthday ever. It was also very nice that I had vacation all week. I didn't really do that much, but I got a lot of stuff done.

I can not believe that Jasmine Trias made through to the final 3 on American Idol ! I guess everyone felt really sorry for her after her horrible performance yesterday, especially when she started crying....

Unfortunately for me, my 2-year old iPod just died. It wouldn't get past the Apple logo. Fortunately, I bought an extended warranty from CompUSA when I bought it. I took it back and they gave me a brand new one, a new model with twice as much space! The new iPods are really slick. I love the dock. It takes a little getting used to the buttons being slightly different, but overall I can't complain. With the new iPod, I finally installed iTunes software. It's not all that. I'm not sure what the big deal is, not counting the on-line store feature. Anyways.... Get one if you can. You won't regret it.
Happy Mother's Day, Mom! I love you!

I can't believe it. "Friends" is over. Yes, Cindy, Doug, Todd, Holly, and myself were part of that 51 million who tuned in for the end of an era. I'm sure I'll still catch it in reruns from time to time, but it won't be the same. Must See TV just won't be the same without "Friends" and with "The Apprentice" moving in. Luckily "Will & Grace" and "ER" will still be around. "I'll be there for you...'cause you're there for me too...."
